creator: falcore@fbs.net
text:
Apache 1.3.7 running on redhat 7.3 adv server using thier build of apache.

In my attempt to do something I now realize was not the best idea.  I wanted to 
run two diffrent cgi-bin.  I wanted to run two diffrent cgi-bin for 2 diffrent 
virtual servers for the same ip address.  Basically I wanted to run one bin for 
port 80 and one for port 443 for our secure server.  Apache really didnt 
appericate this and the service would not restart.  I commented out the virtual 
server and tried to restart apache.  It restarted this time but every instance 
of it except the core one started by root was showing up as apache <defunct>.  
I tried going back to an old good confg file still no go.  I rebooted the 
server still no go.  I had to rpm -e --nodeps apache and reinstall the rpm to 
fix the problem.  I looked on message boards for this problem and I did not see 
anyone else having a problem like this.  I have resolved the issue but I wanted 
to report it whether it helps anyone or not.

creator: slive@apache.org
text:
Thanks for the report, but I don't think there are enough details here
to identify exactly what happened.
